attributes.action: Intervention against insurance companies regecting valid covid business claims
attributes.background:
My claim is valid based on policy wording but my insurance company refuse the  claim blaming my loss of income on government closure and  not covid 19
Initially insurance companies said without mandatory closure they cannot do anything, a complete contrast to their current stance

rejection.details:
The decision to pay out under a policy is one for individual insurance companies, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you are unhappy with the decision of your insurer you should complain directly to them.

If you are unsatisfied with how an insurer responds to your complaint you may wish to contact the financial ombudsman: https://www.financial-ombudsman.org.uk/businesses/complaints-deal/insurance

You can find information about financial assistance available to businesses here: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/financial-support-for-businesses-during-coronavirus-covid-19
